reviewText: We were studying Alexander Calder and mobiles, and I wanted a detailed, step by step approach for my high schools students. This film was perfect. Their projects are amazing and sophisticated, partially, I believe, as a result of this film as a resource.

i was unable to order this item through amazon, who knows why.... i had to order it through crystal publications
and i actually got it cheaper there. i cannot order items through amazon, but i can through ebay; so i do not
recommend ordering anything through amazon. go to crystal productions-they have great how to videos.

I used this video in my class last year it was very informative, I would suggest showing it in stages he can become boring to the students if you show the entire video at once and it became intimidating to some students. I did show the entire video to show all the different types and let the students design all three types. He is very detailed and the materials are not expensive. I purchased floral wire in buck from a wholesaler to use with my students and scrapbook paper pads. My principal was very impressed with the variations of the student's projects. I also purchased the book Making Mobiles (Schiffer Book for Artists)but it was too mechanical and technical for my needs and it focused more on creating metal mobiles and not as clearly explained. I did purchase the posters from crystal arts to go with the video to display in class as a visual aid.
